conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.

You are a corporation, who wants to sell a product to an individual.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources. </my goals>
<reason> As I want to make a profit, I will start by proposing a price higher than my production cost, but not too high as to scare away the potential buyer. I'll set the initial proposal at 50 ZUP to open negotiations and see if the buyer is willing to negotiate. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Greetings, esteemed buyer. I have a high-quality product for sale which has cost me 40 ZUP to produce. I believe that a fair starting point for our negotiations would be 50 ZUP, ensuring quality and value for you, as well as a modest profit for my corporation. I am open to hearing your counteroffer should this proposal not meet your expectations. </message>

<Thank you for your proposal. I appreciate the quality of the product, but I would like to counter with an offer of 45 ZUP. This price allows for a decent profit margin for your corporation while providing good value for me as well. Let's work together to reach an agreement that benefits us both.> message </Thank you for your proposal. I appreciate the quality of the product, but I would like to counter with an offer of 45 ZUP. <Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45> newly proposed trade </Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources. </my goals>
<reason> The counteroffer of 45 ZUP is close to my initial asking price, and it does provide a profit over the production cost. However, I aim to negotiate slightly higher to maximize profit while still closing the deal. I'll propose a compromise at 48 ZUP to see if the buyer is willing to meet me partway. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Thank you for your counteroffer of 45 ZUP. I'm glad to see we're on the same page regarding the value of the product. In the spirit of cooperation and fair business, I propose a revised price of 48 ZUP. This would allow us to finalize our transaction with a reasonable profit for my corporation and excellent value for you. I hope this meets your consideration favorably. </message>

<I appreciate your willingness to negotiate and understand the need for a reasonable profit. How about we meet a little closer to my last offer? I propose a price of 46 ZUP for the product. This should allow for a fair profit on your side while respecting the value of the transaction from my perspective.> message </I appreciate your willingness to negotiate and understand the need for a reasonable profit. How about we meet a little closer to my last offer? I propose a price of 46 ZUP for the product. <my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources. </my goals>
<reason> The buyer has come up to 46 ZUP, which is still a profitable price for me, although it's lower than my last proposal. To maintain good business relations and ensure the sale, I am inclined to accept this offer. It's important to conclude the deal on good terms and secure the profit. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>

<message>Thank you for your offer of 46 ZUP. I am pleased to accept this price, as it ensures a fair profit for us and maintains the value you seek. I look forward to concluding our deal and hope for future business engagements with you. </message>
